oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Will of Richard Gardner
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Gardner, Richard
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: US 31 at jct with Dixontown Rd, Elkton, Giles County, TN
Photocopy of the handwritten will of Richard Gardner.

The Matt Gardner House is significant for African-American ethnic heritage, commerce, and architecture. Matt Gardner was born a slave, supposedly on July 18, 1848, on a Chester, North Carolina plantation owned by a white family known as Gardner. In 1870, he married and began to build a life based on his preaching, farming, and sound business sense.
